title: Mag flux - 5 m-squared rectangle in 4 T field

content.description: A uniform magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="4.0 teslas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4.0</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext></mstyle></math> is directed at an angle of <math alttext="30 degrees" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mn>30</mn> <mo>°</mo> </mstyle> </math> to the plane of a rectangular loop of area <math alttext="5.0 meters squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>5.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure.
content.question: What is the magnetic flux through the loop?

choices.label: <math alttext="10 tesla meters squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="17 tesla meters squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>17</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="20 tesla meters squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="10 tesla meters squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
